page.title: 16UNHILL WOOD, OXFORDSHIRE.
page.content:
Unhill Wood, which lies in the north western corner of our D-block is {Ancient Woodland.} This means that there has been a wood here for many hundreds of years (since before detailed maps were produced). Ancient woods usually contain{many tree {species,}and{some rare plants}such as Herb Paris, which flowers only when the ground has been undisturbed for a very long time. Just inside the edge of Unhill Wood is a{low bank}which was probably the{original boundary}of the wood. This is another indication that the wood is old.
Today Unhill Wood is quiet and peaceful. Game birds nest here in Spring. There are deer and badgers and many wild birds. Chalk downland flowers grow on grass verges at the edge of the wood.
